content.description:
Are you an experienced Product Manager who's owned the development of SaaS products looking for an opportunity to lead a team within a rapidly growing startup where you will be given autonomy to own your roadmap?

As a Senior Product Manager here at Humi, you will make an immediate impact by building products to support our business’ rapid growth. You will guide a cross-functional squad through the development of complex features, working with others to make tradeoff decisions, prioritize the right things, and ensure we are shipping extremely high-quality products. You will work closely with a cross-functional team of Engineers, UX, and Marketers as well as customers to define, build, and launch mission-critical initiatives.

You should be a team player, natural leader, and consistent influencer in regards to the "why" and the "what" of your area of focus. You will constantly strive for domain expertise by immersing yourself in the HR space.

Who are we?

Humi’s mission is to help organizations throughout Canada foster their greatest asset – their employees. Starting with a powerful yet intuitive HR, payroll, benefits, and insurance platform, Humi has established a leadership position as the only company addressing all of these needs in one place. With a potential reach spanning every business in Canada, and a platform that touches every employee at every business that uses it, Humi is reimagining the future of work.

Humi is backed by the same group who funded Slack, Carta, and more (Tribe Capital), the top value-based U.S. accelerator (Y-Combinator), as well as several of the world’s leading angel investors.

We’re hiring across Canada and are open to applicants who prefer to work remotely!

We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce, representative of the communities we serve and beyond. We encourage and are pleased to consider, applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, women, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ+ persons, and others who contribute towards promoting innovative ideas and solutions. 

https://www.humi.ca/about

lists.content:
• You will be responsible for product ownership, including backlog grooming, triage and prioritization, and cross-functional coordination
  • You will be defining the scope of development for new product features and ongoing feature enhancements including all management of backlog and development activities
  • You will write and prioritize epics, user stories, and define acceptance criteria
  • You will establish and maintain a high level of credibility with internal and external stakeholders
  • You will leverage your analytical ability to back your decisions with data
  • You will effectively use data and analytics layered against high-quality user research to inform the direction of the product line
  • You will be responsible for tracking progress, assessing risks, coordinating delivery, and actively communicate contingency and mitigation plans for the team
  • You will run various ad-hoc research and business analyses to assess opportunities and risks
lists.text: What you will be doing as a Senior Product Manager?

lists.content:
• Onboard and integrate into the Humi Product team
  • Become acquainted with your product area, the product goals, and those you will work closely with
  • Independently start to study and learn the Humi product suite
  • Independently start to build a knowledge base and domain expertise within the payroll domain
  • Talk with customers to build knowledge and empathy toward our users
lists.text: In the first 30 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Immerse yourself in our product development and build process
  • Work cross-functionally and with product leadership to organize and prioritize your high-level roadmap and backlog
  • Start working closely with your development and design team
  • Continue to learn the Humi product suite
  • Take over all in-flight and planned initiatives
lists.text: In the first 60 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Fully support a product area, working with product leadership to complete quarterly planning and set OKRs
  • Fully own roadmap planning for the swim lanes within your product squad
  • Ship features that deliver high business impact
  • Be fully embedded into and owning a development team
  • Monitor and measure the success of your initiatives against company goals
  • Continuously improve your team’s practice and processes
lists.text: In the first 90 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Work with product leadership to discover new product opportunities for your backlog
  • Develop a repeatable model for delivering upon your roadmap initiatives
  • Work with other product managers to measure and refine your roadmap, backlog, and processes to make improvements over time
  • Constantly re-evaluate your roadmap’s alignment with the strategic goals of the business, adjusting where necessary
  • Deliver on your roadmap priorities and promises
  • Ensure your team has an incredible record of building impactful products in a timely and elegant fashion
  • Have worked cross-functionally to scale your team to meet the growing needs of our business and our users
  • Ship product that directly supports the success of our company objectives
lists.text: In the first year you will:

lists.content:
• 4+ years of software Product Management experience
  • Sophisticated understanding of the digital finance space
  • Financial and accounting math knowledge
  • Ability to influence others through leadership and strong communications skills
  • Ability to keep up in a fast-paced and pivot in a dynamic environment
  • Ability to analyze data as well as to conduct research through various discussions with customers and teammates
  • Ability to create wireframes and user flows to articulate ideas to product designers
  • Detail-oriented with a high bar for quality when writing user stories, reviewing designs, brainstorming technical approaches, and testing a feature before it is released
  • Be humble, willing to learn, and do whatever is needed to help your team members to accomplish the team goals
  • Experience using agile development methodologies with globally distributed teams
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • You must be a world-class individual contributor and team player to thrive at Humi
  • Completed Bachelor of Science Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Administration
lists.text: What are we looking for in a Senior Product Manager?

lists.content:
• You have a passion for the HR tech, recruiting, or fintech space
  • You've worked in a cross-functional team previously where you and your squad took ownership of the success of an area of focus
lists.text: Bonus points:

lists.content:
• As a team that services the HR world, we are a team that understands you perform best in an environment that cares about their employees
  • Be part of a high performing team of critical thinkers that thrive on problem solving
  • Access leadership and growth opportunities as the company rapidly scales
  • Maintain work-life engagement with flex hours and our Long(er) weekends initiative
  • Opportunity to work fully remote anywhere across Canada if you choose to
lists.text: Why join the Humi Team?

lists.content:
• You will process payroll for our managed clients ensuring timely communication, accurate payroll and benefit adjustments, ROE submissions and detailed reporting
  • You will support our Experience Managers with payroll technical know-how and new CRA guidelines 
  • You will own the on-going payroll processing and advisory for our managed payroll clients while defining the best in class experience.
lists.text: What will you be doing as an Associate, Payroll Services?

lists.content:
• Meet the Co-Founders
  • Introduction to the Client Experience (CX) and Product Experience (PX) team
  • Introduction to the Sales team
  • Introduction to Payroll stakeholders
  • HR 101 with the Director of HR 
  • Manage day-to-day expectations
  • Discuss KPIs
  • Receive access and training to CX tools: Hubspot, Zendesk, Asana etc.
  • Walkthrough client implementation process
  • Walkthrough managed payroll process 
  • Shadow PX and assist running managed payroll
  • Receive product training on all our modules: HR, Payroll and Benefits.
  • Pair-tackle client tickets
  • Shadow PX calls: HR, Payroll and Benefits
lists.text: In your first 30 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Independently respond to client tickets
  • Independently run client payroll
  • Manage client portfolio
  • Have clear understanding of concepts introduced during focused learning sessions
  • Able to navigate through various platforms and softwares
lists.text: In your first 60 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Contribute to internal Q&A forum and knowledge base
  • Take ownership of role and look for opportunities of improvement over current processes
  • Comfortable seeking guidance from resources outside of immediate team members
  • Participate in stakeholder interviews held by product managers to aid product development
lists.text: In your first 90 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Add value to role by taking on more responsibilities outside of core duties
  • Complete large scale projects involving multiple stakeholders
  • Comfortable tackling issues involving advanced application of payroll concepts
  • Upgrade skills by participating in ongoing workshops
lists.text: In your first year, you will:

lists.content:
• 2+ years of payroll experience 
  • Experience or knowledge in accounting, or financial sectors 
  • Self-starter who has the ability to juggle and support multiple clients and meet tight deadlines 
  • Tech savvy and ability to pick up new platforms and software quickly 
  • Strong communication skills with a customer service mindset and team mindset
  • Self starter with a resourceful attitude when problem solving and dealing with ambiguity 
  • Analytical and strategic thinker who looks for opportunities and spearheads innovation that will drive better process improvements
  • Completed post secondary degree in Accounting, Finance, Payroll or other relevant areas 
  • Payroll Compliance Practitioner (PCP) certification or Certified Professional Accountant (CPA) is an asset
  • Experience working in a fast pace startup is an asset
lists.text: What are we looking for in an Associate, Payroll Services?

lists.content:
• As a team that services the HR world, we are a team that understands you perform best in an environment that cares about their employees
  • Be part of a high performing team of critical thinkers that thrive on problem solving 
  • Access leadership and growth opportunities as the company rapidly scales
  • Maintain work-life engagement with flex hours and our Long(er) weekends initiative
  • Opportunity to work fully remote across Canada if you choose to
lists.text: Why join the Humi Family?

  • You will be the first point of contact for all incoming calls for the Client Experience team.
  • You will build a strong product knowledge to resolve customer inquiries, questions and concerns with accuracy and in a timely manner.
  • You will work with subject matter experts to resolve complex matters. 
  • You will write and create user friendly manuals and support guides on different product features and upgrades for customers.
lists.text: What will you be doing as a Client Support Associate?

lists.content:
• Meet the Co-Founders
  • Get introduced to the Client Experience (CX) and Product Experience (PX) team
  • Get introduced to the Sales team
  • Get introduced to Payroll stakeholders
  • Meet with the Director of HR for an HR 101
  • Manage day-to-day expectations
  • Discuss KPIs
  • Receive access and training to CX tools: Hubspot, Zendesk, Airtable etc.
  • Walkthrough client implementation process
  • Participate in a client implementation
  • Receive platform training on all our modules: HR, Payroll and Benefits.
  • Pair tackle client tickets
  • Shadow CX calls: HR, Payroll and Benefits
  • Shadow sales calls
lists.text: In your first 30 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Demonstrate excellent product knowledge
  • Demonstrate the ability to resolve client problems with accuracy and efficiency
  • Demonstrate an affinity for troubleshooting and problem identification
  • Demonstrate the ability to differentiate support requests from technical requests
  • Be responsible for achieving KPIs
  • Own a macro project: CX initiatives to improve current processes and procedures, and establish new ones
  • Attend professional development workshops: Excel and SQL
lists.text: In your first 60 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Demonstrate sound judgment in triage and escalation 
  • Demonstrate an understanding of Humi processes and how to fit client processes to them
  • Demonstrate empathy; can put themselves in the clients shoes 
  • Demonstrate strong communication skills in client problem solving
  • Demonstrate strong organizational skills when logging support requests 
  • Demonstrate an understanding of when there is a risk of churn
  • Fulfil custom reporting for clients
  • Participate in your first quarterly performance review
lists.text: In your first 90 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Continue to improve on the objectives above
  • Demonstrate the ability to independently manage complex implementations with multiple requirements
  • Demonstrate the ability to makes evidence and business-backed decisions when handling escalations 
  • Demonstrate the ability to consistently identify the root cause of an issue whether process or product related 
  • Demonstrate the ability to convey technical requests with exact specifications 
  • Demonstrate the ability to be articulate, a teaching partner for clients 
  • Demonstrate the ability to defuse tense situations 
  • Demonstrate an ability to analyze support requests and convey process expansion
  • Mentor new hires and assist with training 
  • Participate in your first annual review
lists.text: In your first year, you will:

lists.content:
• 1+ years of customer service experience
  • Thirst for learning and the ability to pick up new technology and concepts quickly 
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Self motivated with a positive attitude and a sense of urgency
  • Problem solver 
  • Outgoing, friendly, and personable
  • Thrives in team environments and is able to work independently
  • Basic understanding of SQL
lists.text: What are we looking for in a Client Support Associate?

lists.content:
• As a team that services the HR world, we are a team that understands you perform best in an environment that cares about their employees
  • Be part of a high performing team of critical thinkers that thrive on problem solving 
  • Access leadership and growth opportunities as the company rapidly scales
  • Maintain work-life engagement with flex hours and our Long(er) weekends initiative
  • Opportunity to work fully remote across Canada if you choose to
lists.text: Why join the Humi Family?

content.description:
Are you a high performer looking to make a bigger impact? Do you enjoy solving problems with other high performers while having the autonomy you need to succeed? Do you want to be part of a fast growing company that helps Canadian businesses and their employees? If these words resonate with you, then you would really thrive in the growing Finance team at Humi as our newest Finance Administrator.

We are looking for a highly motivated and hard working candidate to join Humi to take on the challenge of supporting the scaling of the company. We are looking for an organized individual who will enable our business to gain insights in a more timely and accurate manner. You will be a key member of our growing Finance team and will own processes involving data entry, data analysis, and reporting.

Who are we?
Humi’s mission is to help organizations throughout Canada foster their greatest asset – their employees. Starting with a powerful yet intuitive HR, payroll, benefits, and insurance platform, Humi has established a leadership position as the only company addressing all of these needs in one place. With a potential reach spanning every business in Canada, and a platform that touches every employee at every business that uses it, Humi is reimagining the future of work.

Humi is backed by the same group who funded Slack, Carta, and more (Tribe Capital), the top value-based U.S. accelerator (Y-Combinator), as well as several of the world’s leading angel investors.

We’re hiring across Canada and are open to applicants who prefer to work remotely!

We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce, representative of the communities we serve and beyond. We encourage and are pleased to consider applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, women, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ2S+ persons, and others who contribute towards promoting innovative ideas and solutions. 

What will you be doing as a Finance Administrator?
Reporting into the Finance Manager, you will play an integral part in the organization and maintenance of key databases. You will be working to deliver information to leadership while collaborating with and supporting other teams. This is a great opportunity to learn and help build the foundation of the Finance team of a fast-growing startup.

lists.content:
• Inputting Benefits Commissions statements into our database
  • Preparing the monthly and quarterly commissions for internal staff
  • Preparing Partnership commissions
  • Assisting the Support team with client billing communications
  • Assisting with Accounts Receivable reach out and management
lists.text: Your responsibilities include:

lists.content:
• Understand the business environment we operate it
  • Learn most of the tools you will be operating in
  • Understand the timelines and reporting requirements that your work will feed into
lists.text: In your first 30 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Assist with inputting carrier statements into the database
  • Assist with the calculation of internal commissions
  • Assist with the calculation of partner commissions
lists.text: In your first 60 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Understand the flow of information and the key role your tasks play in that process
  • Own the data entry process for carrier commission statements
  • Prepare monthly commissions for internal and external parties
  • Assist with the Accounts Receivable management process
lists.text: In your first 90 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Have contributed to data timeliness & quality at the organization
  • Enable the team to close our accounting books faster
  • Contribute to a more efficient accounts receivable process, ensuring the business gets paid on time
  • Support the year-end closing process
lists.text: In your first year, you will:

lists.content:
• You have a keen eye for detail and have great organizational skills
  • You are a curious individual who wants to understand if something doesn’t make sense
  • You have some experience with data entry and improving processes
  • You have the ability to problem solve and work within ambiguity 
  • You are highly proficient in advanced functions in Microsoft Excel 
  • You are a self-starter that has a can-do attitude who has the ability to pick up new information quickly and work through ambiguity
lists.text: What are we looking for in a Finance Administrator?

lists.content:
• You have previous experience within a Finance team in a growing company 
  • You have previous experience working with Stripe, AirTable, Xero or similar tools
lists.text: Nice to Have Skills:

lists.content:
• Our team supports every department that helps create solutions that build the future of work. We are a team that understands you perform best in an environment that cares about its employees
  • Be part of high performing team of critical thinkers that thrive on problem-solving
  • Participate in shaping the future of work, and being rewarded with meaningful equity
  • Access leadership and growth opportunities as the company rapidly scales
  • Maintain work-life balance with the flexibility to take mid-day appointments and flex hours
  • Participate in hard-skill development workshops as well as lunch and learns
  • Opportunity to work fully remote across Canada if you choose to
lists.text: Why Join the Humi Team?

content.description:
Product marketing is an exciting practice that is becoming integral to nearly every modern business. At Humi, we’re building it right now – this is an environment where not all the rules are set, so there’s a ton of room to contribute and make a real impact.  We work swiftly and with high standards, but not without support, guidance, and room for making mistakes. We’re a team that genuinely cares about one another, and strive for continuous improvement, self-reflection, and a culture of feedback. If you’re excited to contribute to a team of passionate and motivated people, and are ready to learn in a fast-growing company, this is for you.

Who are we?
Humi’s mission is to help organizations throughout Canada foster their greatest asset – their employees. Starting with a powerful yet intuitive HR, payroll, benefits, and insurance platform, Humi has established a leadership position as the only company addressing all of these needs in one place. With a potential reach spanning every business in Canada, and a platform that touches every employee at every business that uses it, Humi is reimagining the future of work.

Humi is backed by the same group who funded Slack, Carta, and more (Tribe Capital), the top value-based U.S. accelerator (Y-Combinator), as well as several of the world’s leading angel investors.

We’re hiring across Canada and are open to applicants who prefer to work remotely!

We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce, representative of the communities we serve and beyond. We encourage and are pleased to consider applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, women, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ2S+ persons, and others who contribute towards promoting innovative ideas and solutions.

• Create, manage and execute go-to-market strategies for new product feature launches to ensure they are effectively marketed, sold and adopted
  • Conduct ongoing research and analysis on the competitive landscape,  and maintain competitor intel resources to support internal teams 
  • Develop, maintain and share sales enablement materials on product positioning and messaging for Humi’s various product modules
  • Conduct and assist with win-loss interviews to understand our buyers and the market landscape, including identifying prospects to contact and post-interview analysis
  • Support with product adoption and cross-sell campaigns by working with CX, Product, and Marketing teams
  • Collaborate with Content Marketing to market our product by developing product webinars, marketing assets, and website updates
lists.text: What will you be doing as a Product Marketing Specialist?

lists.content:
• Attend Humi’s immersive onboarding program that will give you an overview of all aspects of the business and meet leadership and other key stakeholders
  • Onboard and get to know the Marketing team
  • Meet and start to build relationships with the Product Managers
  • Familiarize yourself with the GTM framework and processes
  • Familiarize yourself with the role of product marketing at Humi
  • Walk through ongoing projects and department goals with the Senior Product Marketing Manager

lists.content:

  • Own and execute your first product feature launch
  • Create your first sales enablement asset with Content Marketing
  • Sit in on your first win-loss interview 
  • Watch and review sales demos to understand how we position to buyers
  • Review all competitor and sales enablement assets,  provide recommendations for improvement, and start to action them
lists.text: In your first 60 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Be an expert on the competitive and industry landscape, providing insights to equip Sales knowledge and to help Product prioritize product development
  • Conduct regular win-loss interviews, analyze insights, and share findings and recommendations for action with internal teams
  • Continuously improve the development and delivery of sales enablement and marketing assets
lists.text: In your first 90 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Have a natural ability to communicate with others and be a people person! As an empathic team player who cares about building genuine relationships, you find it easy to make a phone call or network in a crowd (virtual or in-person) and strike up a meaningful conversation with a potential team member—but can equally step up when you have to write a thoughtful rejection email
  • Have previous Recruitment/Talent Acquisition experience (ideally 2-3 years, bonus points if it's in the technology sector)
  • Be proactive in your communication, to both candidates, and hiring managers. You know how to set expectations and you have a track-record for delivering results
  • Be hyper-organized and almost never let the little things slip by you. You can navigate your calendar in your sleep, you live by checklists and most importantly - you never forget a stand-out candidate’s name
  • Advocate for yourself and your teammates; you've never said, “that’s not my job” when asked for help by others
  • Be driven to provide nothing less than an amazing candidate experience—you have proven this in past roles by going above and beyond to make sure candidates leave happy, regardless of the final outcome
  • Have a demonstrated passion for thoughtfully building holistically diverse and inclusive teams using a strategic growth mindset
  • Be driven to connect the right people to the right roles at the right company - which may be another role at another company
  • Be comfortable with poking holes in existing recruitment processes to help evolve the candidate experience, with the ability to accept feedback
lists.text: In your first year, you will:

lists.content:
• 1-2 years work experience in a related field (marketing or product)
  • A basic understanding of product marketing functions
  • Strong communication skills, including copywriting and presentation
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to manage internal stakeholders
  • You thrive in team environments and are able to execute projects independently 
  • Strong organization, time, and project management skills 
  • Self-motivated with a growth mindset and embraces continuous learning
  • Values a culture of open feedback and communication
  • Bonus if you have experience at a tech company
  • Bonus again if you have familiarity with Asana, Mailchimp, and Pendo
lists.text: What are we looking for in a Product Marketing Specialist?

lists.content:
• As a team that services the HR world, we are a team that understands you perform best in an environment that cares about their employees
  • Be part of a high performing team of critical thinkers that thrive on problem solving 
  • Access leadership and growth opportunities as the company rapidly scales
  • Maintain work-life engagement with flex hours and our Long(er) weekends initiative
  • Opportunity to work fully remote across Canada if you choose to
lists.text: Why join the Humi Team?

content.description:
Are you an experienced Mobile Software Engineer looking to be part of a team where your opinions will be heard and where you are encouraged to be innovative? 

This past year has given us a renewed perspective on how we approach work, the impact of remote work, and as result has highlighted the impact of reliable and scalable HR and payroll software. With the creation of our new mobile team, we aim to enable thousands of our customers to do more on their mobile devices. 

Our Engineering team is growing and we are looking for strong Software Engineers who have a passion for building highly scalable and robust systems. As a Senior Mobile Software Engineer, you will be an integral part of the larger engineering team and be the second in command on the mobile team. You’ll be in a position where you will be able to innovate and be directly contributing to the roadmap and the development direction of the mobile application. 

Who are we?
Humi’s mission is to help organizations throughout Canada foster their greatest asset – their employees. Starting with a powerful yet intuitive HR, payroll, benefits, and insurance platform, Humi has established a leadership position as the only company addressing all of these needs in one place. With a potential reach spanning every business in Canada, and a platform that touches every employee at every business that uses it, Humi is reimagining the future of work.

Humi is backed by the same group who funded Slack, Carta, and more (Tribe Capital), the top value-based U.S. accelerator (Y-Combinator), as well as several of the world’s leading angel investors.

We’re hiring across Canada and are open to applicants who prefer to work remotely!

We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce, representative of the communities we serve and beyond. We encourage and are pleased to consider applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, women, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ2S+ persons, and others who contribute towards promoting innovative ideas and solutions. 

What are we looking for in a Senior Mobile Software Engineer?
From day one, you will be working in one of our cross-functional squads; and collaborating along with the rest of the team to deliver on new features and exciting initiatives.
As a senior within the team, you will help us scale, and mentor the junior members of the team. Your work will directly impact building a world-class all-in-one HR, payroll, benefits, and insurance platform.

lists.content:

  • Dynamic and entrepreneurial team building the next generation of HR, payroll, benefits, and insurance platform
  • Additional health and wellness programs include a health spending account, virtual health through Akira, an employee assistance program with counseling and coaching through Inkblot

  • Small, dynamic teams = massive impact

content.closing: Let’s do this! We can’t wait to hear from you.

content.description:
We have undergone a lot of growth in the past 12 months and have even more exciting plans ahead of us! 

We are looking to add a data-driven, people-focused, and curious Talent Acquisition Specialist to our team to help us grow at scale. Your role will be to work closely with our Hiring Managers to understand their needs and the role requirements and grow our unique and diverse team. At times you will also be a key player in supporting other Talent Acquisition Specialist team members with additional projects, offer letters, pre-screens and scheduling. This role will report to our Technical Talent Acquisition Manager on our People Operations team.

You will play a critical role in shaping the culture of our organization, bringing in top talent who live our values, and bringing new perspectives and ideas to Humi. You'll be an ambassador of our culture!

Who are we?
Humi’s mission is to help organizations throughout Canada foster their greatest asset – their employees. Starting with a powerful yet intuitive HR, payroll, benefits, and insurance platform, Humi has established a leadership position as the only company addressing all of these needs in one place. With a potential reach spanning every business in Canada, and a platform that touches every employee at every business that uses it, Humi is reimagining the future of work.

Humi is backed by the same group who funded Slack, Carta, and more (Tribe Capital), the top value-based U.S. accelerator (Y-Combinator), as well as several of the world’s leading angel investors.

We’re hiring across Canada and are open to applicants who prefer to work remotely!

We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce, representative of the communities we serve and beyond. We encourage and are pleased to consider applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, women, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ2S+ persons, and others who contribute towards promoting innovative ideas and solutions. 

What are we looking for in a Talent Acquisition Specialist?
As the Talent Acquisition Specialist, you will be the team member that works collaboratively to run full-lifecycle recruitment activities for all of our roles, as well as plan initiatives to build an outstanding candidate experience and employer branding activities. You’ll play a pivotal role, positively impacting how we attract and hire exceptional people who are the heart and soul of the entities we support.

Your natural ability to connect with others is essential as you’ll work with various people, from candidates to internal teams. Your ability to work quickly, efficiently and with care will play a key role in building our world-class People team at Humi. Having a “can-do” attitude and stepping up to the plate is what we are all about!

This mid entry-level role is embedded in Humi's growing People Operations team, on the Talent Acquisition side. We know that to deliver on our culture, to care about our Humigos, and to continue to make Humi a great place to work - we need a candidate-focused team member in this role.

What will you be doing as a Talent Acquisition Specialist?
In this role, you'll manage our ATS for all roles across the departments (Client Experience, Sales, Marketing, Insurance, Finance, Operations, Engineering and People), help manage the end-to-end general recruitment process for the team and use your negotiation skills to help us hire bright and talented people who are looking to make an impact by improving the lives of Canadian SMBs. Ultimately, you will build a strong talent pipeline and help hire and retain skilled employees for Humi's growth.

You will also get the chance to work on internal People Operations projects and other initiatives within the organization that interests you.

lists.content:

  • 10% learning from and shadowing other members of the recruiting team to identify ways to improve the sourcing and recruiting process and we grow
  • 10% relationship management and networking with talent partners

  • Manage the active candidate pipeline—you’ll do your own coordinating and handle all communications with all candidates directly within your owned roles
  • Support the creation of all policy, documentation, and internal projects
  • Identify 1 special project that will help enhance the candidate experience at Humi

lists.text: What are we looking for in a Talent Acquisition Specialist?

lists.content:
• Improve our general recruitment process, from sourcing through to hiring, by identifying opportunities to make an even more positive and candidate-centric experience
  • Maintain and evolve our interview processes, working with our hiring managers to deliver a welcoming, consistent, and equitable candidate experience for every candidate
  • Work with our hiring managers to develop inclusive job descriptions (impact statements) that will speak to our target audiences of job seekers
  • Conduct resume screening and phone interviews, maintain applicant records, provide timely communication and feedback to candidates
  • Coordinate with candidates, hiring managers, and interview peers to schedule interviews and discussions
  • Have experience and a passion for building a diverse recruiting pipeline
  • Collaborate with our People team to divide and conquer the recruiting workload and identify opportunities for process improvements
  • Work with the marketing team to build our employer brand, improve our career’s page content, and build our Glassdoor presence
  • Work cross-functionally with all teams to meet ambitious department growth targets
  • Be curious and have a scrappy "roll up your sleeves" approach to work
  • Bonus points if you have worked in a scaling start-up or growing small-business environment

lists.content:

lists.text: Why join Humi?

content.description:
We’re so proud of our HQ office. The location is great: we’re steps from Union station, there is a streetcar right outside our door, two bike share stations across the street, and we’re a short walk from many amazing and local restaurants and cafes. Best of all - we’re right on the water. We’ve got an incredible view, we’re right on the boardwalk and there’s an outdoor skating rink right next door. We need your help to create the best in-person experience for our Humigos using this space. If you’re a people-lover, love curating experiences and enjoy thinking outside the box, then this role is for you!

Who are we?

Humi’s mission is to help organizations throughout Canada foster their greatest asset – their employees. Starting with a powerful yet intuitive HR, payroll, benefits, and insurance platform, Humi has established a leadership position as the only company addressing all of these needs in one place. With a potential reach spanning every business in Canada, and a platform that touches every employee at every business that uses it, Humi is reimagining the future of work.

Humi is backed by the same group who funded Slack, Carta, and more (Tribe Capital), the top value-based U.S. accelerator (Y-Combinator), as well as several of the world’s leading angel investors.

We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce, representative of the communities we serve and beyond. We encourage, and are pleased to consider, applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, women, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ2S+ persons, and others who contribute towards promoting innovative ideas and solutions.

lists.content:
• You will be in charge of maintaining our in-office booking system Officely (sending reminders for survey responses, adding guests, adding Newmigos to the system, coordinating Vaccine Passport Proof & recording, coordinating with our IT Specialist to get virtual key cards set up).
  • You will assist with the packaging & delivery of onboarding packages.
  • You will be the main point of contact to communicate any issues with the unit to building management.
  • You will assist with in-office Tech Inquiries (setting up meeting rooms, grabbing equipment) - in the case our IT Specialist is absent.
  • You will be responsible for making sure the office is up and running daily (ordering + replenishing our snacks, unloading/loading the dishwasher, coffee machine maintenance, stocking up our beverage fridges (beer, coffee, soft drinks! general tidiness, appropriate signage in accordance to COVID-19 policies in place, making sure all sanitization stations are stocked, assist in beautifying the space).
  • You will support our HR and Talent Acquisition team with light administrative duties such as posting jobs, entering or pulling data from our ATS, setting up or sending surveys and more.
lists.text: What will you be doing as an Office & People Coordinator?

lists.content:
• Have worked in a scaling start-up or growing small-business environment
  • Prior experience in HR as an asset (posting jobs, scheduling interviews, pulling data from the ATS, updating candidate profiles etc.)
lists.text: Bonus points if you:

lists.content:
• Goal setting session with the Director, People Operations
  • Walkthrough current processes and procedures
  • Continue supporting our in-office experience and maintain the physical space
  • Training with HR & Office tools: Humi, Notion, Slack, Peakon, Fellow.app, Officely etc.
lists.text: In your first 30 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Maintain and edit any new/existing policies, documentation and internal projects
  • Identify 1 special project or policy that will help enhance the office experience at Humi
  • Maintain the office experience budget with Director, People Operations
  • Become familiar with Humi’s suppliers in order to enhance the office experience
lists.text: In your first 60 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Be an expert on the tools and technology we use at Humi
  • Demonstrate exceptional knowledge of the Humi culture and embody that in-person and when working online
  • Present your overall findings of procedures that are working, areas that can be improved, and make at least one creative recommendation for an existing initiative 
  • Participate in your first quarterly performance review
lists.text: In your first 90 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Demonstrate strong industry knowledge in recruiting and onboarding best practices by creating creative experiences for Humigos
  • Demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills with colleagues
  • Have an affinity for finding a problem and recommending a creative solution
  • Participate in your first annual review
lists.text: In your first year, you will:

lists.content:
• Prior experience managing and supporting office duties (greeting visitors, light clean up, setting up meeting rooms, ordering supplies & snacks, accepting and signing packages, putting together new hire onboarding packages etc.)
  • Experience with Google Suite, Slack, Fellow.app, Notion, Officely and Open Path 
  • Exposure to the HR space
  • Flexible, detail oriented, accurate and strong communication skills required
  • Passionate when it comes to delivering a great internal employee experience
  • Willingness to step up to the plate to help team members
  • Proactive mentality and highly organized
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality and discretion at all times
lists.text: What are we looking for in an Office & People Coordinator?

lists.content:
• As a team that services the HR world, we are a team that understands you perform best in an environment that cares about their employees
  • Be part of a high performing team of critical thinkers that thrive on problem solving 
  • Access leadership and growth opportunities as the company rapidly scales
  • Maintain work-life engagement with flex hours and our Long(er) weekends initiative
  • Opportunity to work fully remote across Canada if you choose to
lists.text: Why join Humi?

content.description:
Do you get energized when you’re able to demonstrate the power and potential of data through real results? Are you creative when it comes to innovative data-driven solutions and driving growth while improving efficiency? We hope you answered yes if you’ve been reading this so far!

We are looking for someone who is ready to centralize our data vision and establish a data-driven culture within our organization. If you pride yourself on your ability to engage with all levels of the business to address priorities and challenges all the while identifying areas that data and analytics solutions can solve, then keep reading about why this is the team for you!

The data team was introduced a year and a half ago, and we are looking for an entrepreneurial and results driven leader to help foster the growth of the data operations, data analytics, and data engineering functions within it to reach its next level of maturity. Here at Humi, you will flourish if you are bursting with creativity and looking for a company that has data hungry teams across all functions looking to be empowered to be more data savvy.

Who are we?

Humi’s mission is to help organizations throughout Canada foster their greatest asset – their employees. Starting with a powerful yet intuitive HR, Payroll, Benefits, and Insurance platform, Humi has established a leadership position as the only company addressing all of these needs in one place. With a potential reach spanning every business in Canada, and a platform that touches every employee at every business that uses it, Humi is reimagining the future of work.

Humi is backed by the same group who funded Slack, Carta, and more (Tribe Capital), the top value-based U.S. accelerator (Y-Combinator), as well as several of the world’s leading angel investors.

We’re hiring across Canada and are open to applicants who prefer to work remotely!

We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce, representative of the communities we serve and beyond. We encourage and are pleased to consider applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, women, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ2S+ persons, and others who contribute towards promoting innovative ideas and solutions.

content.description:
We're a scaling technology company that is looking for a product visionary to build out the strategy for the next stage of our growth. Over the last five years, Humi has built a very special foundation. We are Canada’s leading and fastest growing people technology platform. Our platform touches tens of thousands of lives every day, moves millions of dollars, and supports thousands of businesses in achieving their goals. We are at an inflection point of both growth and product maturity, and are searching for a confident, passionate, and ambitious leader who can build an innovative and impactful vision on top of this unique foundation.

The opportunities to extend into the depths of the employer and employee ecosystem, both locally and globally, are almost endless. Few platforms will offer this type of reach and impact. Do you want to help businesses recruit with less bias, help employees engage with their peers in more meaningful ways, or unlock and redefine business and employees access to financial services? In this role, you will have the autonomy and platform to decide how we can best leverage what we’ve built, to build an even more meaningful future. We're not just here to enable businesses to manage employees; we're here to educate businesses on how to invest and cultivate a vibrant and successful employe base. In order to do that, we need a VP Product who becomes intimately familiar with the problems our customers have at multiple stages of growth and how we can support, educate and lead them through that journey.

This leadership position will lead both Product Managers, and User Experience (UX) professionals. Leading a mid-sized team of over 12 people, you will drive the product vision, strategy and roadmap. You’ll collaborate with a cross-functional team (including Engineering, Client Experience (CX) and our Sales and Marketing teams) to create a world-class product.

This is a remote-first position; Humi hires across Canada.

What are we looking for in a VP, Product?
You sweat the small stuff because you know that overlooking the details is dangerous. Your attention to detail leads to well-thought-through, elegantly designed, and beautifully executed solutions, and you're able to instill that ethos in the wider team. You continually challenge the organization to reach higher levels of quality without sacrificing efficiencies and help the team define when good enough really is good enough.

lists.content:
• Immediately assume significant responsibility driving product roadmap, direction, and strategy
  • Inspire our teams and clients, building the storyline that drives Humi's impact through product
  • Serve on the leadership team which includes the Chief Executive Officer, Chief Commercial Officer, VP Engineering, VP Operations and Director of People Operations
  • Identify our most critical product KPIs and methodically prioritize products and features to improve them
  • Prioritize resources and projects to maximize our growth and create high-quality products
  • Build alignment and work collaboratively with cross-functional partners (Engineering, Marketing, Client Experience, and Operations) to deliver intuitive product solutions
  • Build an environment that measures performance excellence by setting the definitions of success for our product, setting cascading goals for each squad, and measuring the impact of product releases
  • Work to create an intimate understanding of the market in order to identify growth areas and strategies for the product roadmap
  • Empower the Product Management department by defining the structure, strategy, and PM practices that are needed to enable our people to approach complex and ambiguous situations with clarity and focus
lists.text: How Will I Make An Impact?

lists.content:
• Proven visionary who has experience creating a product strategy and roadmap from scratch, and scaling in a start-up environment (leading to significant scale)
  • Proven track record in modern B2B product management
  • Extensive experience leading product teams, inspiring multi-disciplinary squads to build and drive to execution
  • Passionate and obsessive about design, content, and brand
  • Experience working in fast-growing startups
  • An entrepreneurial drive and demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment, while building extensible and scalable solutions
  • Strong user empathy and an excellent understanding of best-in-class user experiences
  • World-class product vision, strategy, planning, development, and execution
  • Strong analytical, data, and troubleshooting skills to bring a data-driven approach to product management
lists.text: Must haves:

lists.content:
• You have a passion for the HR tech space
  • Public speaking skills and a willingness to share your thinking within the Product community
  • Prior experience working in a venture-backed company
lists.text: Nice to haves:

lists.content:
• Insight Driven
    • You use data to predict innovative ways that the product can address our current customer needs while thinking ahead of the market. You use data insights to ensure that you deeply understand the markets’ problems and define the right priorities for both the short and long-term.
  • Product Story-telling 
    • Set strategy and influence others to think big about where we are headed and how we will get there. You paint the bigger picture by building a compelling story and sharing that narrative. You can create/clarify strategy within very ambiguous areas with no guidance, and can clearly explain to stakeholders, why we are pursuing one set of priorities versus another.
  • Execution 
    • You know what to ship, and when. You have a stubborn focus on understanding, refining, and articulating the problem (or opportunity) the team is solving. When done well, the whole team is oriented around the problem and able to explain it themselves. Think big, start small. You are most directly responsible for ensuring the Product squads constantly fight to scope smaller to learn faster, balancing an ambition to think expansively about the opportunity.
  • Performance
    • You will work across the business to determine: how new & existing customers find out about it, what the monetization approach is, how Sales will sell and how Client Experience will support it.
  • Driving outcomes 
    • Shipping is our heartbeat. There can be no changed outcome and limited learning without shipping. Great product teams demonstrate a consistent shipping cadence. But it’s not just the speed at which we ship, we very much care about the quality of the product. You are able to inspire and encourage multiple teams to push for a higher bar for quality across the broader system.
  • Leadership behaviours
    • VP, Product inspires and motivates the team to work towards a clear, compelling vision. You communicate clearly, concisely, and assertively. You build confidence through being opinionated and persuasive, and in doing so - can build engaged, high-performing collaborative, and inclusive teams.
lists.text: What We're Expecting from You

content.closing:
The Hiring Process
We move quickly, but do our due diligence. We will move the process forward in a way that makes sense and works for the goals of Humi's hiring plans, and the availability of your application. Only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview.

1. Application. Once you've confirmed your interest and submitted your application, we'll be in touch within 3 business days

2. Story Call with the CEO. We want to know what lights you up, the challenges you've faced in your career, your approach to leading a Product organization, and what you're looking for in your next role and team.

3. Connect with the Team. We want you to get to know us. You'll meet with leaders within the SLT, UX, Engineering and of course - the Product team members in up to 3 different conversations. If you feel like someone has been missed in the process - let us know! We want you to know the team you'll be leading

4. Final Decision-making. Once we've made an offer, you'll have the opportunity to ask questions about the nitty-gritty details. All of our offers are conditional on completing references and a background check.


If you require assistance throughout the interview process, please email talent@humi.ca.

content.description:
Are you an experienced Product Manager who's owned the development of SaaS products looking for an opportunity to lead a team within a rapidly growing startup where you will be given autonomy to own your roadmap?

As a Senior Product Manager here at Humi, you will make an immediate impact by building products to support our business’ rapid growth. You will guide a cross-functional squad through the development of complex features, working with others to make tradeoff decisions, prioritize the right things, and ensure we are shipping extremely high-quality products. You will work closely with a cross-functional team of Engineers, UX, and Marketers as well as customers to define, build, and launch mission-critical initiatives.

You should be a team player, natural leader, and consistent influencer in regards to the "why" and the "what" of your area of focus. You will constantly strive for domain expertise by immersing yourself in the HR space.

What you will be doing as a Senior Product Manager?
This role will be hyper-focused on the HR aspect of our product. Humi is an all-in-one solution product with a hub and spoke modular product. The role will immediately manage a squad focused on recruiting, but will also support other areas of focus in the HR product. We're looking for someone who has a strong interest in building tools that help growing companies get the most out of their people, and tools that enable employees to get the most out of their companies.

We're looking for someone who has a strong interest in building tools that help growing companies get the most out of their people, and tools that enable employees to get the most out of their companies.

  • You will be defining the scope of development for new product features and ongoing feature enhancements including all management of backlog and development activities
  • You will write and prioritize epics, user stories, and define acceptance criteria
  • You will establish and maintain a high level of credibility with internal and external stakeholders
  • You will leverage your analytical ability to back your decisions with data
  • You will effectively use data and analytics layered against high-quality user research to inform the direction of the product line
  • You will be responsible for tracking progress, assessing risks, coordinating delivery, and actively communicate contingency and mitigation plans for the team
  • You will run various ad-hoc research and business analyses to assess opportunities and risks

lists.text: In the first 30 days, you will:

lists.content:

  • Work cross-functionally and with product leadership to organize and prioritize your high-level roadmap and backlog
  • Start working closely with your development and design team
  • Continue to learn the Humi product suite
  • Take over all in-flight and planned initiatives
lists.text: In the first 60 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Fully support a product area, working with product leadership to complete quarterly planning and set OKRs
  • Fully own roadmap planning for the swim lanes within your product squad
  • Ship features that deliver high business impact
  • Be fully embedded into and owning a development team
  • Monitor and measure the success of your initiatives against company goals
  • Continuously improve your team’s practice and processes
lists.text: In the first 90 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Work with product leadership to discover new product opportunities for your backlog
  • Develop a repeatable model for delivering upon your roadmap initiatives
  • Work with other product managers to measure and refine your roadmap, backlog, and processes to make improvements over time
  • Constantly re-evaluate your roadmap’s alignment with the strategic goals of the business, adjusting where necessary
  • Deliver on your roadmap priorities and promises
  • Ensure your team has an incredible record of building impactful products in a timely and elegant fashion
  • Have worked cross-functionally to scale your team to meet the growing needs of our business and our users
  • Ship product that directly supports the success of our company objectives
lists.text: In the first year you will:

lists.content:
• 4+ years of software Product Management experience
  • Sophisticated understanding of the digital finance space
  • Financial and accounting math knowledge
  • Ability to influence others through leadership and strong communications skills
  • Ability to keep up in a fast-paced and pivot in a dynamic environment
  • Ability to analyze data as well as to conduct research through various discussions with customers and teammates
  • Ability to create wireframes and user flows to articulate ideas to product designers
  • Detail-oriented with a high bar for quality when writing user stories, reviewing designs, brainstorming technical approaches, and testing a feature before it is released
  • Be humble, willing to learn, and do whatever is needed to help your team members to accomplish the team goals
  • Experience using agile development methodologies with globally distributed teams
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • You must be a world-class individual contributor and team player to thrive at Humi
  • Completed Bachelor of Science Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Administration
lists.text: What are we looking for in a Senior Product Manager?

lists.content:
• You have a passion for the HR tech, recruiting, or fintech space
  • You've worked in a cross-functional team previously where you and your squad took ownership of the success of an area of focus

We're looking for someone who has a strong interest in building tools that help growing companies get the most out of their people, and tools that enable employees to get the most out of their companies.

We're looking for someone who has a strong interest in building tools that help growing companies get the most out of their people, and tools that enable employees to get the most out of their companies.

lists.content:
• You will be responsible for product ownership, including backlog grooming, triage and prioritization, and cross-functional coordination
  • You will be defining the scope of development for new product features and ongoing feature enhancements including all management of backlog and development activities
  • You will write and prioritize epics, user stories, and define acceptance criteria
  • You will establish and maintain a high level of credibility with internal and external stakeholders
  • You will leverage your analytical ability to back your decisions with data
  • You will effectively use data and analytics layered against high-quality user research to inform the direction of the product line
  • You will be responsible for tracking progress, assessing risks, coordinating delivery, and actively communicate contingency and mitigation plans for the team
  • You will run various ad-hoc research and business analyses to assess opportunities and risks

• Onboard and integrate into the Humi Product team
  • Become acquainted with your product area, the product goals, and those you will work closely with
  • Independently start to study and learn the Humi product suite
  • Independently start to build a knowledge base and domain expertise within the payroll domain
  • Talk with customers to build knowledge and empathy toward our users
lists.text: In the first 30 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Immerse yourself in our product development and build process
  • Work cross-functionally and with product leadership to organize and prioritize your high-level roadmap and backlog
  • Start working closely with your development and design team
  • Continue to learn the Humi product suite
  • Take over all in-flight and planned initiatives
lists.text: In the first 60 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Fully support a product area, working with product leadership to complete quarterly planning and set OKRs
  • Fully own roadmap planning for the swim lanes within your product squad
  • Ship features that deliver high business impact
  • Be fully embedded into and owning a development team
  • Monitor and measure the success of your initiatives against company goals
  • Continuously improve your team’s practice and processes
lists.text: In the first 90 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Work with product leadership to discover new product opportunities for your backlog
  • Develop a repeatable model for delivering upon your roadmap initiatives
  • Work with other product managers to measure and refine your roadmap, backlog, and processes to make improvements over time
  • Constantly re-evaluate your roadmap’s alignment with the strategic goals of the business, adjusting where necessary
  • Deliver on your roadmap priorities and promises
  • Ensure your team has an incredible record of building impactful products in a timely and elegant fashion
  • Have worked cross-functionally to scale your team to meet the growing needs of our business and our users
  • Ship product that directly supports the success of our company objectives
lists.text: In the first year you will:

lists.content:
• 2+ years of SaaS Product Management experience
  • Ability to influence others through leadership and strong communications skills
  • Ability to keep up in a fast-paced and pivot in a dynamic environment
  • Ability to analyze data as well as to conduct research through various discussions with customers and teammates
  • Ability to create wireframes and user flows to articulate ideas to product designers
  • Detail-oriented with a high bar for quality when writing user stories, reviewing designs, brainstorming technical approaches, and testing a feature before it is released
  • Be humble, willing to learn, and do whatever is needed to help your team members to accomplish the team goals
  • Experience using agile development methodologies with globally distributed teams
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • You must be a world-class individual contributor and team player to thrive at Humi
lists.text: What are we looking for in a Product Manager?

lists.content:
• You have a passion for the HR tech, recruiting, or fintech space
  • You've worked in a cross-functional team previously where you and your squad took ownership of the success of an area of focus
lists.text: Nice to haves:

content.description:
Are you ready to make a change? This year has given us all the opportunity to reevaluate how we’re growing our careers and if we’re having the impact we want on the world while doing so.

This Intermediate role sits at the heart of both those missions. Our UX team is just getting started on growing and we are looking for strong team members who have a passion for purposeful work, thinking big, and teamwork. The opportunities for impact here are endless as we build out both the UX practice and team in service of amazing experiences for our customers. 

We're embedded on product teams so that we can be involved with projects from the get-go and work really closely with other disciplines at every stage of the process. Designers are an integral part of evolving and defining how Humi makes the world better for employers and employees. 

What will you be doing as a Product Designer?
You’ll work closely with your product and engineering team members to ensure we’re solving the right problems and designing elegant solutions through an iterative, data-informed process.  As a team member, you’ll contribute to creating the conditions for world-class work to be delivered every day.

content.description:
Our Engineering team keeps growing and we are looking for strong developers who have a passion for diving deep to build highly scalable and robust systems! All the while collaborating deeply with others on a kind, helpful and innovative team. As a key player on this team, you will be ready to deep dive into problems with the support of your team all the while weighing the cost and value in order to take the action that makes the most sense.

As a Senior Software Engineer on one of our Payroll software engineering squads, you will be an integral part of the engineering team. You will be facilitating the direction of projects with the team and stakeholders while driving creative solutions to our customer’s problems. If you have an aptitude for weighing in on tradeoffs between different technical approaches that could be taken then we want to hear from you!

Who are we?

Humi’s mission is to help organizations throughout Canada foster their greatest asset – their employees. Starting with a powerful yet intuitive HR, payroll, benefits, and insurance platform, Humi has established a leadership position as the only company addressing all of these needs in one place. With a potential reach spanning every business in Canada, and a platform that touches every employee at every business that uses it, Humi is reimagining the future of work.

Humi is backed by the same group who funded Slack, Carta, and more (Tribe Capital), the top value-based U.S. accelerator (Y-Combinator), as well as several of the world’s leading angel investors.

We’re hiring across Canada and are open to applicants who prefer to work remotely!

We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce, representative of the communities we serve and beyond. We encourage and are pleased to consider applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons/persons of colour, women, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ2S+ persons, and others who contribute towards promoting innovative ideas and solutions. 

https://www.humi.ca/about

content.description:
Are you ready to innovate? This past year has given us a renewed perspective on how we approach work, the impact of remote work, and as result has highlighted the impact of reliable and scalable HR and payroll software. 
We are changing it up on the front end from Angular to the oh-so-fun language of React. We are looking for front-end gurus to help us with this major transformation. 

Our Engineering team is growing and we are looking for strong developers who have a passion for building highly scalable and robust systems. As a Senior TypeScript Software Engineer in our Platform squad, you will be an integral part of the engineering team, and be in a position to help introduce new frameworks, tools, and architecture to build capacity within the platform as we scale and empower product Software Engineers to have a better experience when building and shipping new features. 

What will you do as a Senior TypeScript Software Engineer?
From day one, you will be working in one of our most impactful teams; and collaborating along with the rest of the team to deliver on new capabilities, tooling, and exciting initiatives.

As a senior within the engineering organization, you will help us scale, and mentor the junior members of the frontend team. Your work will have a direct impact on building a world-class all-in-one HR platform.

content.description:
What will you be doing as a Business Development Representative?
You’ll be responsible for prospecting and qualifying new leads. Your main goal is to set up demos for our Account Executives and build strong relationships with Canadian small and medium sized businesses (SMBs), from law firms to startups, restaurants to colleges.
content.descriptionHtml:
What will you be doing as a Business Development Representative?
You’ll be responsible for prospecting and qualifying new leads. Your main goal is to set up demos for our Account Executives and build strong relationships with Canadian small and medium sized businesses (SMBs), from law firms to startups, restaurants to colleges.

lists.content:
• Drive Humi’s revenue growth through outreach emails & phone-calls with a focus on setting demo appointments for the sales team
  • Research prospect contact information and best ways to get in touch with them - let your creativity fly with songs, dances, poems and more 
  • Work closely with your teammates and leadership to come up with new, better ways of doing things
  • Nurture and qualify new leads that turn into quality demo appointments
  • Educate prospects on Humi’s HR, payroll, and benefits solutions
  • Work closely with Sales & Marketing on various projects that are in support of the entire BDR team. Want to know more? Check out this guide.
lists.text: If you’re dying to break into the world of fast growing startups and ready to grow your career in sales, we would love to speak with you! In this role you will:

lists.content:
• Meet the co-founders and learn about Humi’s history and future (it’s a very bright looking future!) 
  • Receive access and training to your sales tools: Hubspot, Salesloft, Zoominfo
  • Receive product training on all our modules: HR, payroll, and benefits
  • Learn about why thousands of companies have chosen Humi and the benefits we deliver daily to them
  • Learn how SaaS sales work - recieve an in-depth education on how sales works (it’s much more methodical and strategic than you think! Charisma has nothing to do with it)
  • Start to prospect - you’ll send your first email and make your first phone call before the end of your first week
lists.text: In your first 30 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Be comfortable working independently while still receiving daily feedback
  • Start to understand the nuance of matching different value propositions to different personas
  • Have a clear understanding of the expectations in your role and how to achieve them, including hitting your weekly activity metric
  • Start implementing your own ideas
lists.text: In your first 60 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Create a career and goals plan 
  • Begin making modifications to pitches and talk tracks based on data
  • Continue your education around Humi’s competitive advantage and continue to strengthen your business acumen
  • Consistently achieve your activity goals and begin hitting your sales targets
  • Become an expert on internal tools and processes
lists.text: In your first 90 days, you will:

lists.content:
• Have a strong history of hitting quota
  • Shown leadership as the team grows
  • Be positioned to either move into a Jr. Account Executive role and start closing your own deals or take on more leadership responsibilities in the BDR team
lists.text: In your first year, you will:

lists.content:
• Must be a team player and highly self-motivated, with endless empathy
  • Excellent at being adaptable to change and switching priorities
  • Proven ability to sell with a minimum 1 year of experience in the service industry, field sales, door to door, retail or in a professional capacity 
  • The ability to deal with and thrive on objections and rejection daily
  • Proficient in conducting detailed data analyses and using metrics to drive business results
  • Very strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Not scared of picking up the phone and talking to strangers
  • Desire to move up the ranks and become an Account Executive or team leader in the future required
lists.text: What are we looking for in a Business Development Representative?

content.description:
What will you be doing as a Product Designer?
You’ll work closely with your product and engineering team members to ensure we’re solving the right problems and designing elegant solutions through an iterative, data-informed process.  As a team member, you’ll contribute to creating the conditions for world-class work to be delivered every day. 

In your first 30 days, you will:
Participate in Humi’s immersive onboarding program to learn about all aspects of the business while meeting with cross-functional collaborators 
Build empathy through direct access to customers in sales and customer support calls 
Be assigned to and get to know the problem space, product vision, and members of your product team
Work with your lead to build out a tailored goals and education plan in place to set you in the right direction for the upcoming quarter

In your first 60 days, you will:
Work with a product manager to learn about more about a specific a problem space 
Present your work and insights to stakeholders and team members many times
Participate in pair design sessions with other design team members
Contribute to the UX team’s culture, processes and practices

In your first 90 days, you will: 
Ship your first feature in partnership with your product and engineering counterparts
Have formed opinions on feature strategy and shared them with stakeholders
Participate in recruitment and onboarding activities for the UX team

What are we looking for in a Product Designer?
A keen eye for good design and attention to detail
A passion for solving core product problems while working through all facets of a user experience (strategy, IA, and interaction design)
Appreciation for the end to end iterative UX product design process, including researching user needs, user stories, journey mapping, content modeling, wireframing and prototyping, and testing
Experience collaborating with multiple disciplines including product and engineering, in pursuit of the best outcomes for customers
A deep empathy for the user, advocating for them, always
An interest in executing a data-informed approach to design
At least 3 years experience designing SaaS products

Let’s do this! We can’t wait to hear from you.
